TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is currently serving a prison sentence in Geguti no . CARDINAL Prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in connection with a robbery .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted him and CARDINAL others of conspiracy to commit robbery . The conviction was based on various evidence , including the statements of the victim , who had identified the applicant and the other accused as the perpetrators during the trial . The applicant was sentenced to DATE in prison .

CARDINAL . As disclosed by the transcript of the trial , the victim , a person of NORP origin who had difficulty in speaking NORP , was assisted by an interpreter . The lawyers of the accused , including that of the applicant , extensively examined the victim and other witnesses for the prosecution .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against the conviction of DATE , calling into question the lower court ’s assessment of the evidence and accusing the investigating authority of procedural omissions . He stated , in particular , that the victim ’s incriminating statements lacked credibility , in so far as the victim had been examined at the investigation stage without the assistance of an interpreter .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , replying to all his major arguments , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal of DATE . As regards the complaint concerning the victim ’s statements , the court noted that the conviction had been based on the statements given during the trial , rather than on those obtained at the investigation stage . Having reviewed those statements , the appellate court confirmed their credibility .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision of CARDINAL DATE dismissing the applicant ’s appeal was finally upheld by ORG of GPE on DATE .

According to the case file , prior to the initiation of the criminal proceedings against the applicant and his consequent detention , he had had no major medical problems and was in good health . Notably , he had been a member of a wrestling club in GPE and , as his coach confirmed , had been in excellent physical condition and been considered a promising sportsman at that time .
CARDINAL . The case file also contains a document dated DATE from the ORG tuberculosis hospital , stating that the applicant had never been registered as a patient there .
CARDINAL . Subsequent to his arrest on DATE , the applicant was placed in GPE no . FAC , where he allegedly shared a cell with prisoners infected with pulmonary tuberculosis ( “ GPE ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was transferred to Geguti no . CARDINAL Prison , where his state of health began to deteriorate from DATE . His symptoms were fever and a cough .

CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to a complaint of CARDINAL DATE from the applicant ’s mother , a medical expert examined the applicant , diagnosing him with GPE . On DATE he was transferred to FAC , where prisoners with GPE were housed .

CARDINAL ORG issued an opinion which confirmed that the applicant ’s right lung had been affected by GPE , with a positive sputum culture , and that the disease was at the stage of disaggregation ; the applicant was occasionally coughing up blood . The opinion further disclosed that the applicant had started receiving anti - TB medication under the ORG programme ( Directly Observed Treatment , Short - course – the treatment strategy for detection and cure of ORG recommended by ORG ) on DATE . Notably , he had been prescribed with DATE dosages of such conventional antibiotics as isoniazid ( QUANTITY ) , ethambutol ( QUANTITY mg ) , rifampicin , pyrazinamide ( QUANTITY mg ) and streptomycin ( CARDINAL gr ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prison authorities arranged for the applicant ’s sputum culture and sensibility to be tested by ORG . The results of those tests , issued on DATE , showed that the sputum culture was already negative . It was also established that the applicant ’s GPE bacterium maintained sensitivity with respect to the administered antibiotic drugs , which confirmed the suitability of the ongoing treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prison authority arranged for another round of specific bacteriological tests ( smear , culture and susceptibility ) , the results of which , issued on DATE , disclosed that the applicant ’s treatment was continuing to show promising results .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s treatment was completed , and on the following day he was transferred from ORG to Geguti no . CARDINAL Prison . The termination of the treatment was based on the opinion of the doctor who had been monitoring the applicant since DATE , as well as on the results of laboratory tests of the applicant ’s sputum , dated DATE , which confirmed that GPE bacilli were no longer present in the applicant ’s lungs .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s medical file further discloses that during the whole period of his treatment , from DATE until DATE , his intake of antibiotics had been closely monitored by medical personnel with the appropriate training .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prison authorities arranged for an X - ray examination of the applicant ’s thorax , the results of which confirmed that there were no new tubercular signs in the applicant ’s lungs , thus excluding the risk of relapse .
